comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: James Marion Baker (1861–1940) was a South Carolina attorney who became assistant Senate librarian in 1883 and, twenty years later, managed to become Secretary of the Senate, a post he then held from 1913 to 1919. James Baker page at the U.S. Senate website.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  We'll add the additional identification to the source data and reload the description.
